meanings.definition: To remove errors or defects from (a computer program)
meanings.sent1: She debugs the code to fix any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: He always debugs his programs before submitting them.
meanings.sent3: The programmer debugs the code with a determined look on her face.
meanings.sent4: Debugging the program is like finding a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent5: After she debugs the code, it runs smoothly without any issues.

meanings.definition: To identify and eliminate errors or defects in (a system or process)
meanings.sent1: He debugs the system to ensure it functions correctly.
meanings.sent2: The IT specialist debugs the network to improve its performance.
meanings.sent3: Debugging the process turned out to be easier than expected.
meanings.sent4: She debugs the system with precision and expertise.
meanings.sent5: The team debugs the process to streamline operations and increase efficiency.
